channel.title: Help with my claim system

item.title: Help with my claim system
item.dc:creator: @Zh1 Zh
item.description:
@Zh1 wrote:

[quote=“owndscape, post:1, topic:304335”]within my server i have donator and use ::claim with a random pin number for people to claim items such as dclaws my problem is i dont understand how to make it check more than one text document for the pin number say that i want it to check dclaw.txt bluephat.txt and red h’ween.txt find which one of those it is and add the item corrctly here is the code that i have just for dclaws [code]if (command.startsWith(“claim”) && command.length() > 10 && playerRights < 3)
{

String pin = command.substring(6);

if (checkLog(“dclaw”, pin) && (freeSlots()>1))
{
removepin(“dclaw”,pin);
if (checkLog(“dclaw”, pin)) {
return;
}
addItem(11005,1);
writeLog(""+playerName+" claimed dclaws: "+pin, “rewards”);
disconnected = true;
}
}[/code][/quote]

Well after the first if statement you use another one, why not use an else statement, Idk if it matters, I not pro java.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with my claim system
item.dc:creator: @owndscape owndscape
item.description:
@owndscape wrote:

within my server i have donator and use ::claim with a random pin number for people to claim items such as dclaws my problem is i dont understand how to make it check more than one text document for the pin number say that i want it to check dclaw.txt bluephat.txt and red h’ween.txt find which one of those it is and add the item corrctly here is the code that i have just for dclaws [code]if (command.startsWith(“claim”) && command.length() > 10 && playerRights < 3)
{

String pin = command.substring(6);

if (checkLog(“dclaw”, pin) && (freeSlots()>1))
{
removepin(“dclaw”,pin);
if (checkLog(“dclaw”, pin)) {
return;
}
addItem(11005,1);
writeLog(""+playerName+" claimed dclaws: "+pin, “rewards”);
disconnected = true;
}
}[/code]
